poem:
In Praise of Lists

This morning I scribble 
the grocery items, 
then tack on Dante's circles, 
the constellations, 
and the chapters of my own 
uneventful life—
how lightly we grasp
our days and dreams,
hoping they'll hold together,
how a list flaps in the breeze,
a little flag
we wave to civilization.
